Lithic Xeric Natrargids
GEBA. Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Lithic Ustic Natrargids
GEBB. Other Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Lithic Natrargids
GEBC. Other Natrargids that have a lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Xerertic Natrargids
GEBD. Other Natrargids that:
- - 1. In normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and2. Have one or both of the following:
- - - a. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in most years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - - b. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Ustertic Natrargids
EBE. Other Natrargids that:
- - 1. In normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic; and2. Have one or both of the following:
- - - a. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in most years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - - b. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Vertic Natrargids
GEBF. Other Natrargids that have one or both of the following:
- - 1. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Aquic Natrargids
GEBG. Other Natrargids that are either:
- - 1. Irrigated and have aquic conditions for some time in normal years in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. Saturated with water in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface for 1 month or more in normal years.
--------------------------
Durinodic Xeric Natrargids
GEBH. Other Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Durinodic Natrargids
GEBI. Other Natrargids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist.
--------------------------
Petronodic Natrargids
GEBJ. Other Natrargids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions.
--------------------------
Glossic Ustic Natrargids
GEBK. Other Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. Skeletans covering 10 percent or more of the surfaces of peds at a depth of 2.5 cm or more below the upper boundary of the natric horizon; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Haplic Ustic Natrargids
GEBL. Other Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. An exchangeable sodium percentage of less than 15 (or an SAR of less than 13) in 50 percent or more of the natric horizon; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Haploxeralfic Natrargids
GEBM. Other Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. An exchangeable sodium percentage of less than 15 (or an SAR of less than 13) in 50 percent or more of the natric horizon; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Haplic Natrargids
GEBN. Other Natrargids that have an exchangeable sodium percentage of less than 15 (or an SAR of less than 13) in 50 percent or more of the natric horizon.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Natrargids
GEBO. Other Natrargids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Natrargids
GEBP. Other Natrargids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Xeric Natrargids
GEBQ. Other Natrargids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Natrargids
GEBR. Other Natrargids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Glossic Natrargids
GEBS. Other Natrargids that have skeletans covering 10 percent or more of the surfaces of peds at a depth of 2.5 cm or more below the upper boundary of the natric horizon.
--------------------------
Typic Natrargids
GEBT. Other Natrargids.
--------------------------
Vertic Paleargids
GECA. Paleargids that have one or both of the following:
- - 1. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Aquic Paleargids
GECB. Other Paleargids that are either:
- - 1. Irrigated and have aquic conditions for some time in normal years in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. Saturated with water in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface for 1 month or more in normal years.
--------------------------
Arenic Ustic Paleargids
GECC. Other Paleargids that:
- - 1. Have a texture class (fine-earth fraction) of coarse sand, sand, fine sand, loamy coarse sand, loamy sand, or loamy fine sand throughout a layer extending from the mineral soil surface to the top of an argillic horizon at a depth of 50 cm or more; and
- - 2. Have a moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Arenic Paleargids
GECD. Other Paleargids that have a texture class (fine-earth fraction) of coarse sand, sand, fine sand, loamy coarse sand, loamy sand, or loamy fine sand throughout a layer extending from the mineral soil surface to the top of an argillic horizon at a depth of 50 cm or more.
--------------------------
Calcic Paleargids
GECE. Other Paleargids that have a calcic horizon within 150 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Durinodic Xeric Paleargids
GECF. Other Paleargids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Durinodic Paleargids
GECG. Other Paleargids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist.
--------------------------
Petronodic Ustic Paleargids
GECH. Other Paleargids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Petronodic Paleargids
GECI. Other Paleargids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Paleargids
GECJ. Other Paleargids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Paleargids
GECK. Other Paleargids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Xeric Paleargids
GECL. Other Paleargids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Paleargids
GECM. Other Paleargids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Paleargids
GECN. Other Paleargids.
--------------------------
Petrogypsic Ustic Petroargids
GEAA. Petroargids that have both:
- - 1. A petrogypsic horizon within 150 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Petrogypsic Petroargids
GEAB. Other Petroargids that have a petrogypsic horizon within 150 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Duric Xeric Petroargids
GEAC. Other Petroargids that have both:
- - 1. A duripan within 150 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Duric Petroargids
GEAD. Other Petroargids that have a duripan within 150 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Natric Petroargids
GEAE. Other Petroargids that have a natric horizon.
--------------------------
Xeric Petroargids
GEAF. Other Petroargids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Petroargids
GEAG. Other Petroargids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Petroargids
GEAH. Other Petroargids.
--------------------------
Petrocalcids
GFA. Calcids that have a petrocalcic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Haplocalcids
GFB. Other Calcids.
--------------------------
Lithic Xeric Haplocalcids
GFBA. Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Lithic Ustic Haplocalcids
GFBB. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Lithic Haplocalcids
GFBC. Other Haplocalcids that have a lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Vertic Haplocalcids
GFBD. Other Haplocalcids that have one or both of the following:
- - 1. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Aquic Durinodic Haplocalcids
GFBE. Other Haplocalcids that:1. Are either:
- - - a. Irrigated and have aquic conditions for some time in normal years in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface; or
- - - b. Saturated with water in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface for 1 month or more in normal years; and
- - 2. Have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist.
--------------------------
Aquic Haplocalcids
GFBF. Other Haplocalcids that are either:
- - 1. Irrigated and have aquic conditions for some time in normal years in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. Saturated with water in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface for 1 month or more in normal years.
--------------------------
Duric Xeric Haplocalcids
GFBG. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A duripan within 150 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Duric Haplocalcids
GFBH. Other Haplocalcids that have a duripan within 150 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Durinodic Xeric Haplocalcids
GFBI. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Durinodic Haplocalcids
GFBJ. Other Haplocalcids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist.
--------------------------
Petronodic Xeric Haplocalcids
GFBK. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Petronodic Ustic Haplocalcids
GFBL. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Petronodic Haplocalcids
GFBM. Other Haplocalcids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions.
--------------------------
Sodic Xeric Haplocalcids
GFBN. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface that has an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Sodic Ustic Haplocalcids
GFBO. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface that has an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Sodic Haplocalcids
GFBP. Other Haplocalcids that have, in a horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the mineral soil surface, an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Haplocalcids
GFBQ. Other Haplocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Haplocalcids
GFBR. Other Haplocalcids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Xeric Haplocalcids
GFBS. Other Haplocalcids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Haplocalcids
GFBT. Other Haplocalcids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Haplocalcids
GFBU. Other Haplocalcids.
--------------------------
Aquic Petrocalcids
GFAA. Petrocalcids that are either:
- - 1. Irrigated and have aquic conditions for some time in normal years in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. Saturated with water in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface for 1 month or more in normal years.
--------------------------
Natric Petrocalcids
GFAB. Other Petrocalcids that have a natric horizon.
--------------------------
Xeralfic Petrocalcids
GFAC. Other Petrocalcids that have both:
- - 1. An argillic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustalfic Petrocalcids
GFAD. Other Petrocalcids that have both:
- - 1. An argillic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Argic Petrocalcids
GFAE. Other Petrocalcids that have an argillic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Calcic Lithic Petrocalcids
GFAF. Other Petrocalcids that have both:
- - 1. A calcic horizon overlying the petrocalcic horizon; and
- - 2. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Calcic Petrocalcids
GFAG. Other Petrocalcids that have a calcic horizon overlying the petrocalcic horizon.
--------------------------
Xeric Petrocalcids
GFAH. Other Petrocalcids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Petrocalcids
GFAI. Other Petrocalcids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Petrocalcids
GFAJ. Other Petrocalcids.
--------------------------
Aquicambids
GGA. Cambids that are either:
- - 1. Irrigated and have aquic conditions for some time in normal years in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. Saturated with water in one or more layers within 100 cm of the soil surface for 1 month or more in normal years.
--------------------------
Petrocambids
GGB. Other Cambids that have a duripan or a petrocalcic or petrogypsic horizon within 150 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Haplocambids
GGC. Other Cambids.
--------------------------
Sodic Aquicambids
GGAA. Aquicambids that have, in a horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface, an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years.
--------------------------
Durinodic Xeric Aquicambids
GGAB. Other Aquicambids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Durinodic Aquicambids
GGAC. Other Aquicambids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist.
--------------------------
Petronodic Aquicambids
GGAD. Other Aquicambids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Aquicambids
GGAE. Other Aquicambids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Aquicambids
GGAF. Other Aquicambids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Fluventic Aquicambids
GGAG. Other Aquicambids that meet both of the following:
- - 1. Have a total thickness of less than 50 cm of human-transported material in the surface horizons; and
- - 2. Have an irregular decrease in organic-carbon content (Holocene age) between a depth of 25 cm and either a depth of 125 cm below the mineral soil surface or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Xeric Aquicambids
GGAH. Other Aquicambids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Aquicambids
GGAI. Other Aquicambids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Aquicambids
GGAJ. Other Aquicambids.
--------------------------
Lithic Xeric Haplocambids
GGCA. Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Lithic Ustic Haplocambids
GGCB. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. A lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Lithic Haplocambids
GGCC. Other Haplocambids that have a lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Xerertic Haplocambids
GGCD. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. One or both of the following:
- - - a. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - - b. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact if shallower; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustertic Haplocambids
GGCE. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. One or both of the following:
- - - a. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - - b. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact if shallower; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Vertic Haplocambids
GGCF. Other Haplocambids that have one or both of the following:
- - 1. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide through a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the soil surface; or
- - 2. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Durinodic Xeric Haplocambids
GGCG. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Durinodic Haplocambids
GGCH. Other Haplocambids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) durinodes or are brittle and have at least a firm rupture-resistance class when moist.
--------------------------
Petronodic Xeric Haplocambids
GGCI. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Petronodic Ustic Haplocambids
GGCJ. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. One or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Petronodic Haplocambids
GGCK. Other Haplocambids that have one or more horizons, within 100 cm of the soil surface and with a combined thickness of 15 cm or more, that contain 20 percent or more (by volume) nodules or concretions.
--------------------------
Sodic Xeric Haplocambids
GGCL. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. A horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface that has an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Sodic Ustic Haplocambids
GGCM. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. A horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface that has an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years; and
- - 2. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Sodic Haplocambids
GGCN. Other Haplocambids that have, in a horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface, an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Haplocambids
GGCO. Other Haplocambids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Haplocambids
GGCP. Other Haplocambids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Xerofluventic Haplocambids
GGCQ. Other Haplocambids that meet all of the following:
- - 1. Have a total thickness of less than 50 cm of human-transported material in the surface horizons; and
- - 2. In normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 3. Have an irregular decrease in organic-carbon content (Holocene age) between a depth of 25 cm and either a depth of 125 cm below the mineral soil surface or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Ustifluventic Haplocambids
GGCR. Other Haplocambids that meet all of the following:
- - 1. Have a total thickness of less than 50 cm of human-transported material in the surface horizons; and
- - 2. In normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic; and
- - 3. Have an irregular decrease in organic-carbon content (Holocene age) between a depth of 25 cm and either a depth of 125 cm below the mineral soil surface or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Fluventic Haplocambids
GGCS. Other Haplocambids that meet both of the following:
- - 1. Have a total thickness of less than 50 cm of human-transported material in the surface horizons; and
- - 2. Have an irregular decrease in organic-carbon content (Holocene age) between a depth of 25 cm and either a depth of 125 cm below the mineral soil surface or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Anthropic Haplocambids
GGCT. Other Haplocambids that have an anthropic epipedon.
--------------------------
Xeric Haplocambids
GGCU. Other Haplocambids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Haplocambids
GGCV. Other Haplocambids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Haplocambids
GGCW. Other Haplocambids.
--------------------------
Sodic Petrocambids
GGBA. Petrocambids that have, in a horizon at least 25 cm thick within 100 cm of the soil surface, an exchangeable sodium percentage of 15 or more (or an SAR of 13 or more) during at least 1 month in normal years.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Petrocambids
GGBB. Other Petrocambids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Petrocambids
GGBC. Other Petrocambids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Xeric Petrocambids
GGBD. Other Petrocambids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Petrocambids
GGBE. Other Petrocambids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Petrocambids
GGBF. Other Petrocambids.
--------------------------
Salicryids
GAA. Cryids that have a salic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Petrocryids
GAB. Other Cryids that have a duripan, petrocalcic horizon, or petrogypsic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Gypsicryids
GAC. Other Cryids that have a gypsic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Calcicryids
GAD. Other Cryids that have an argillic or natric horizon.Argicryids, p. 123GAE. Other Cryids that have a calcic horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Haplocryids
GAF. Other Cryids.
--------------------------
Lithic Argicryids
GADA. Argicryids that have a lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Vertic Argicryids
GADB. Other Argicryids that have one or both of the following:
- - 1. Cracks within 125 cm of the soil surface that are 5 mm or more wide throughout a thickness of 30 cm or more for some time in normal years and slickensides or wedge-shaped peds in a layer 15 cm or more thick that has its upper boundary within 125 cm of the mineral soil surface; or
- - 2. A linear extensibility of 6.0 cm or more between the mineral soil surface and either a depth of 100 cm or a densic, lithic, or paralithic contact, whichever is shallower.
--------------------------
Natric Argicryids
GADC. Other Argicryids that have a natric horizon within 100 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Argicryids
GADD. Other Argicryids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Vitrandic Argicryids
GADE. Other Argicryids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
--------------------------
Xeric Argicryids
GADF. Other Argicryids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.
--------------------------
Ustic Argicryids
GADG. Other Argicryids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.
--------------------------
Typic Argicryids
GADH. Other Argicryids.
--------------------------
Lithic Calcicryids
GAEA. Calcicryids that have a lithic contact within 50 cm of the soil surface.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Calcicryids
GAEB. Other Calcicryids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.

GAEC. Other Calcicryids that have, throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.

GAED. Other Calcicryids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric.

GAEE. Other Calcicryids that, in normal years, are dry in all parts of the moisture control section for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and have a soil moisture regime that borders on ustic.

Typic Calcicryids

--------------------------
Calcic Gypsicryids
GACA. Gypsicryids that have a calcic horizon.
--------------------------
Vitrixerandic Gypsicryids
GACB. Other Gypsicryids that have both:
- - 1. A moisture control section that, in normal years, is dry in all parts for less than three-fourths of the time (cumulative) when the soil temperature at a depth of 50 cm below the soil surface is 5 oC or higher and a soil moisture regime that borders on xeric; and
- - 2. Throughout one or more horizons with a total thickness of 18 cm or more within 75 cm of the soil surface, one or both of the following:
- - - a. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - - b. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.

- - 1. More than 35 percent (by volume) particles 2.0 mm or larger in diameter, of which more than 66 percent is cinders, pumice, and pumicelike fragments; or
- - 2. A fine-earth fraction containing 30 percent or more particles 0.02 to 2.0 mm in diameter, of which 5 percent or more is volcanic glass, and [(Al plus 1/2 Fe, percent extracted by ammonium oxalate) times 60] plus the volcanic glass (percent) is 30 or more.
